text.__SUMMARY__: Penicillium caseifulvum is a fungus species of the genus of Penicillium which occurs on the surface of blue cheese and causes discoloration in form of brown spots.
text.Further reading: Karl Esser; Paul A. Lemke; J. W. Bennett; Heinz D. Osiewacz (2002). Industrial Applications. Springer Science & Business Media. ISBN 3540415831.
